title: Will a major U.S. airline file a lawsuit against a tech giant over a software-related incident by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a major U.S. airline files a lawsuit against a prominent technology company over a software-related incident that caused significant flight disruptions. The lawsuit must be officially filed in a court of law and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). A 'major U.S. airline' is defined as one of the top 5 airlines by passenger volume in the United States. A 'prominent technology company' refers to a Fortune 500 tech company that provides software or IT services to the airline industry. The incident in question must have resulted in substantial financial losses or operational disruptions for the airline. If no such lawsuit is filed by the specified date, or if a settlement is reached before a lawsuit is filed, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a major US airline file a lawsuit against a cybersecurity firm by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if a major US airline (defined as one of the top 5 airlines by passenger volume) files a lawsuit against a cybersecurity firm by August 31, 2024. The lawsuit must be officially filed and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The lawsuit should be related to a technology outage or software upgrade issue that resulted in significant flight cancellations. If no such lawsuit is filed, or if a lawsuit is filed but does not meet these criteria, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a major tech company publicly announce a settlement with a major airline over a tech outage by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a major tech company publicly announces a settlement with a major airline regarding a technology outage that caused significant flight cancellations. The announcement must come from an official statement by the tech company and be reported by at least two reputable news sources. A 'major tech company' is defined as a company listed in the top 20 of the Fortune 500 technology sector. A 'major airline' is defined as one of the top 10 airlines by revenue globally. The settlement must be directly related to a technology outage that resulted in substantial flight cancellations (more than 1,000 flights). If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

body: This question resolves as YES if a prominent French-Algerian choreographer, known for creating Olympic-related dance showcases, announces a new dance project by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official statement or be reported by at least two reputable news sources. The project should be distinct from any Olympic-related performances. A 'new dance project' is defined as a choreographed performance, dance series, or collaborative work that has not been previously announced or performed. The announcement should include basic details such as the project's concept or intended venue.

title: Will a major opera company announce an American director for a new Ring Cycle production by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a major opera company (such as the Metropolitan Opera, La Scala, or the Royal Opera House) announces that an American director will lead a new production of Wagner's Ring Cycle. The announcement must be made through official channels of the opera company or reported by at least two reputable news sources. The director must be explicitly identified as American, and the production must be confirmed as a new staging of the complete Ring Cycle. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if an announced production is cancelled or significantly altered before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

The planned production does not need to take place within the resolution timeframe; only the announcement is required. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a Democratic presidential nominee announce a running mate by August 31, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the Democratic Party's presidential nominee for the 2024 election officially announces a running mate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be reported by at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News). The nominee's identity is not specified in this question to avoid potential bias. This question resolves as NO if no such announcement is made or widely reported by the specified date.

title: Will France reduce its imports of Russian liquified natural gas by over 20% by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that France has reduced its imports of Russian liquified natural gas by more than 20% compared to the first half of 2023. The reduction must be confirmed by official trade data or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The question resolves as NO if the reduction is 20% or less, or if there is insufficient data to determine the reduction by the resolution date.

body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the French government officially announces a complete halt to importing Russian liquified natural gas (LNG). The announcement must come from an official government statement or be reported by at least two reputable international news sources. The announcement should specifically mention a full cessation of Russian LNG imports, not just a reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if France only announces partial reductions in Russian LNG imports, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Japan's Nikkei 225 index close above 35,000 points by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Japan's Nikkei 225 index closes above 35,000 points on any trading day from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024. The closing value must be reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or CNBC. If the index does not close above 35,000 points within the specified period, the question resolves as NO. In case of any temporary trading suspensions or extraordinary market events, the official closing value as reported by the Tokyo Stock Exchange will be used for resolution.

title: Will a prominent Vietnamese business tycoon's 21-year sentence be reduced by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if a prominent Vietnamese business tycoon, convicted of defrauding stockholders, has his 21-year sentence officially reduced by August 31, 2024. The reduction must be confirmed through official court documents or statements reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the sentence remains unchanged or is increased, the question resolves as NO. The tycoon in question was found guilty of defrauding stockholders of nearly $150 million by falsely inflating the value of his company.

For context, the tycoon was found guilty of falsely inflating the value of his company, resulting in a 21-year prison sentence.

title: Will an athlete from a European country's Olympic team fall ill after a swimming event in the Seine River by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, an athlete from any European country's Olympic team is reported to have fallen ill after participating in a swimming event in the Seine River. The illness must be confirmed by official statements from the country's Olympic committee or medical reports and covered by at least two reputable international news sources. The swimming event must be part of the official Olympic program. For the purpose of this question, 'illness' is defined as any health condition that prevents the athlete from continuing their Olympic participation or requires medical intervention beyond routine care.

title: Will a Marvel superhero movie gross over $700 million worldwide by August, 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if a Marvel superhero movie released in 2024 grosses over $700 million worldwide by August 31, 2024. The gross revenue should be reported by at least two reputable sources such as Box Office Mojo, The Hollywood Reporter, or Variety. The movie must be officially produced or co-produced by Marvel Studios and feature Marvel superhero characters. For the purpose of this question, only the worldwide box office gross will be considered, excluding any additional revenue from streaming, merchandising, or other sources.

The gross earnings will be considered without adjusting for inflation. body: This question will resolve as YES if Ryan Reynolds wins a major acting award (such as an Oscar, Golden Globe, or Screen Actors Guild Award) for his role in a Marvel superhero film by August 31, 2024. The award must be for a performance in a film released between January 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The award must be officially announced and reported by at least two reputable news sources. Major acting awards are defined as those presented by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, Hollywood Foreign Press Association, or Screen Actors Guild. This question will resolve as NO if no such award is won by the specified date.

The nomination must be officially announced by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences for the 96th Academy Awards (typically held in early 2024 for films released in 2023) and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). title: Will Aerosmith reverse their decision to stop touring by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Aerosmith officially announces that they will resume touring, contradicting their previous statement about no longer touring due to Steven Tyler's vocal cord injury. The announcement must come from an official statement by the band or be reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such announcement is made, or if Aerosmith maintains their decision to stop touring, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is specifically about Aerosmith reversing their decision to stop touring, not about announcing a new tour in general.

body: This question resolves as YES if Steven Tyler, lead singer of Aerosmith, performs live in a concert by August 31, 2024. A 'live performance' is defined as Tyler singing on stage at a public or private event, excluding pre-recorded performances or brief guest appearances where he doesn't sing. If no such performance occurs, or if there are only unconfirmed reports of a performance, the question resolves as NO. This question is posed in light of recent concerns about the long-term health of Tyler's voice.
